bug.short_desc: mobile textfields with label as form-row get squeezed together

long_desc.thetext:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #8939 +++
Same behaviour as for the checkboxes and radiobuttons applies for textfields which are added to a form with a corresponding description. they should also retain their size and fore the text to break to the next line.
Current Behavior: When they are not having enough horizontal space, they get shrink horizontally (see screenshot).
Expected Behavior: They should retain their size and break to the next line (next already does that).
How is this going to be handled?
If you want to, you can file a pull request. This speeds up the whole process a lot. :)

Tobias, you mention a screenshot, but there isn't one attached. Also, do you have a playground sample similar to the one in bug #8939 that demonstrates the issue (because shouldn't textfields be flexible per se)? In any case, if you had a bugfix (e.g. pull request), that would be best.
